title: Swiggy operating revenue jumps 36% in FY24, losses down 44%
description: According to the food and grocery delivery company, the rise in revenue is driven by higher commissions and advertising fees, user fees, and incremental revenue from ticket sales for events. Integrating Dineout with the Swiggy app also helped.
content: Public markets-bound food and grocery delivery company Swiggy has reported a 36% year-on-year increase in its operating revenue for FY24 to Rs 11,247 crore, driven by strong growth in its quick commerce vertical Instamart and out-of-home consumption business.The Bengaluru-based company significantly reduced its net loss for the year to Rs 2,350 crore, 44% lower than a year ago, according to its annual report.By comparison, its key rival Zomato reported a net profit of Rs 351 crore in FY24.The fall in Swiggyâ€™s losses happened primarily on account of a controlled year-on-year increase of 8% in its total expenses after it cut staff costs as well as advertising and sales promotion spends.In January this year, Swiggy cut its workforce by 6%, affecting at least 350-400 roles across teams like technology, call centre and corporate roles, ET had reported.
